HoneyGain

Share your internet bandwidth and earn passive income. HoneyGain pays you for sharing your unused internet connection with their secure network for web intelligence and content delivery.

Sign Up Now How to Set Up

About HoneyGain

App Details

Category: Bandwidth Sharing
Monthly Earnings: $15-30
Payment Methods: PayPal, Bitcoin, JumpToken
Minimum Payout: $20
Platforms: Windows, macOS, Android, iOS, Linux
Setup Difficulty: Easy
Resource Usage: Low
Referral Program: 10% of referral earnings forever

Pros & Cons

Pros:

  • Truly passive income requiring no active work after setup
  • Available on multiple platforms (Windows, macOS, Linux, Android, iOS)
  • Minimal impact on internet speed with adjustable bandwidth limits
  • Very low resource usage (less than 1% CPU and 50MB RAM)
  • Multiple payment options including PayPal and cryptocurrencies
  • Legitimate company with consistent payment history since 2018
  • Generous referral program with 10% lifetime earnings from referrals
  • Content Delivery feature for additional earnings
  • Daily Lucky Pot rewards for bonus credits

Cons:

  • Earnings vary significantly based on location (US/EU earn more)
  • Minimum payout threshold of $20 (takes 1-2 months for most users)
  • Content Delivery feature not available in all countries
  • Limited earning potential compared to active income methods
  • Some ISPs may prohibit bandwidth sharing in their terms of service
  • Earnings can fluctuate based on market demand

How HoneyGain Works

HoneyGain works by allowing you to share your unused internet bandwidth with the company's network. This bandwidth is then used for various legitimate business purposes such as:

  • Web intelligence data collection (price comparison, ad verification)
  • Content delivery (improving website load times)
  • Market research and data gathering
  • Brand protection services

The app runs in the background on your devices and only uses bandwidth that you're not actively using. You earn credits based on the amount of data shared, which can then be converted to cash once you reach the minimum payout threshold.

How to Set Up HoneyGain

1

Create an account

Visit the HoneyGain website and sign up with your email address. Be sure to use referral code 'NOSYT123' during registration to receive a $5 signup bonus, giving you a head start toward the $20 minimum payout.

2

Download the app

Download and install the HoneyGain app on multiple devices for maximum earnings. The app is available for Windows, macOS, Linux, Android, and iOS. You can use up to 10 devices per IP address (typically your home network).

3

Log in and optimize settings

Log in to the app with your account credentials on each device. Enable Content Delivery if available in your region for additional earnings. On mobile devices, set the app to use WiFi only if you have limited mobile data. Configure the app to start automatically with your device.

4

Maximize your earnings

Keep your devices running 24/7 if possible to maximize earnings. Check in daily to claim your Lucky Pot bonus (worth $0.10-$0.50 per day). Refer friends to earn 10% of their earnings forever. Consider setting up HoneyGain on a Raspberry Pi for energy-efficient 24/7 operation.

5

Cash out

Once you reach the minimum payout threshold of $20, you can cash out via PayPal, Bitcoin, or JumpToken. Payments are typically processed within 1-3 business days. PayPal is the most reliable option, though crypto payments can be processed faster in some cases.

Sign Up for HoneyGain

Earnings Calculator

honeygain-earnings-calculator.js 
          
            <span class="line-number">1</span>// HoneyGain Earnings Calculator (2025 Rates)
<span class="line-number">2</span>const calculateHoneyGainEarnings = (devices, hours, referrals, location = "US") => {
<span class="line-number">3</span>  // Base rates (2025 updated rates)
<span class="line-number">4</span>  const ratePerGB = 0.15; // $0.15 per GB (increased from previous $0.10)
<span class="line-number">5</span>
<span class="line-number">6</span>  // Data sharing rates vary by device type and usage
<span class="line-number">7</span>  const dataRates = {
<span class="line-number">8</span>    desktop: 0.02, // GB per hour (20MB)
<span class="line-number">9</span>    mobile: 0.01,  // GB per hour (10MB)
<span class="line-number">10</span>  };
<span class="line-number">11</span>
<span class="line-number">12</span>  // Location multipliers (some regions earn more/less)
<span class="line-number">13</span>  const locationMultipliers = {
<span class="line-number">14</span>    "US": 1.0,
<span class="line-number">15</span>    "UK": 1.0,
<span class="line-number">16</span>    "EU": 0.9,
<span class="line-number">17</span>    "Asia": 0.7,
<span class="line-number">18</span>    "Other": 0.6
<span class="line-number">19</span>  };
<span class="line-number">20</span>
<span class="line-number">21</span>  // Calculate device distribution (assuming 70% desktop, 30% mobile)
<span class="line-number">22</span>  const desktopCount = Math.ceil(devices * 0.7);
<span class="line-number">23</span>  const mobileCount = devices - desktopCount;
<span class="line-number">24</span>
<span class="line-number">25</span>  // Calculate total data shared
<span class="line-number">26</span>  const desktopData = desktopCount * hours * dataRates.desktop;
<span class="line-number">27</span>  const mobileData = mobileCount * hours * dataRates.mobile;
<span class="line-number">28</span>  const totalData = desktopData + mobileData;
<span class="line-number">29</span>
<span class="line-number">30</span>  // Apply location multiplier
<span class="line-number">31</span>  const multiplier = locationMultipliers[location] || locationMultipliers.Other;
<span class="line-number">32</span>
<span class="line-number">33</span>  // Calculate base earnings
<span class="line-number">34</span>  const dailyBandwidthEarnings = totalData * ratePerGB * multiplier;
<span class="line-number">35</span>
<span class="line-number">36</span>  // Content Delivery earnings (if applicable)
<span class="line-number">37</span>  // Assuming CD is available 70% of the time and works on desktops only
<span class="line-number">38</span>  const cdHoursPerDay = Math.min(hours, 12); // CD has diminishing returns after ~12 hours
<span class="line-number">39</span>  const cdEarnings = desktopCount * 0.06 * cdHoursPerDay * 0.7 * multiplier;
<span class="line-number">40</span>
<span class="line-number">41</span>  // Lucky Pot earnings (average $0.10-0.50 per day)
<span class="line-number">42</span>  const luckyPotAvg = 0.25; // $0.25 average in 2025
<span class="line-number">43</span>
<span class="line-number">44</span>  // Referral earnings (10% of referrals' earnings)
<span class="line-number">45</span>  // Assuming each referral earns $0.15 per day on average
<span class="line-number">46</span>  const avgReferralEarning = 0.15;
<span class="line-number">47</span>  const referralEarnings = referrals * avgReferralEarning * 0.1; // 10% commission
<span class="line-number">48</span>
<span class="line-number">49</span>  // Calculate total daily earnings
<span class="line-number">50</span>  const totalDailyEarnings =
<span class="line-number">51</span>    dailyBandwidthEarnings +
<span class="line-number">52</span>    cdEarnings +
<span class="line-number">53</span>    luckyPotAvg +
<span class="line-number">54</span>    referralEarnings;
<span class="line-number">55</span>
<span class="line-number">56</span>  // Calculate monthly and annual earnings
<span class="line-number">57</span>  const monthlyEarnings = totalDailyEarnings * 30;
<span class="line-number">58</span>  const annualEarnings = monthlyEarnings * 12;
<span class="line-number">59</span>
<span class="line-number">60</span>  // Days to reach payout threshold
<span class="line-number">61</span>  const daysToPayoutThreshold = Math.ceil(20 / totalDailyEarnings);
<span class="line-number">62</span>
<span class="line-number">63</span>  return {
<span class="line-number">64</span>    dailyBandwidthEarnings: dailyBandwidthEarnings.toFixed(2),
<span class="line-number">65</span>    dailyCDEarnings: cdEarnings.toFixed(2),
<span class="line-number">66</span>    dailyLuckyPot: luckyPotAvg.toFixed(2),
<span class="line-number">67</span>    dailyReferralEarnings: referralEarnings.toFixed(2),
<span class="line-number">68</span>    totalDailyEarnings: totalDailyEarnings.toFixed(2),
<span class="line-number">69</span>    monthlyEarnings: monthlyEarnings.toFixed(2),
<span class="line-number">70</span>    annualEarnings: annualEarnings.toFixed(2),
<span class="line-number">71</span>    daysToPayoutThreshold,
<span class="line-number">72</span>    dataShared: totalData.toFixed(2)
<span class="line-number">73</span>  };
<span class="line-number">74</span>};
<span class="line-number">75</span>
<span class="line-number">76</span>// Example calculation for 3 devices running 24 hours with 2 referrals in the US
<span class="line-number">77</span>const earnings = calculateHoneyGainEarnings(3, 24, 2, "US");
<span class="line-number">78</span>console.log(`
<span class="line-number">79</span>  Daily bandwidth earnings: $${earnings.dailyBandwidthEarnings}
<span class="line-number">80</span>  Daily Content Delivery earnings: $${earnings.dailyCDEarnings}
<span class="line-number">81</span>  Daily Lucky Pot earnings: $${earnings.dailyLuckyPot}
<span class="line-number">82</span>  Daily referral earnings: $${earnings.dailyReferralEarnings}
<span class="line-number">83</span>  Total daily earnings: $${earnings.totalDailyEarnings}
<span class="line-number">84</span>  Monthly earnings: $${earnings.monthlyEarnings}
<span class="line-number">85</span>  Annual earnings: $${earnings.annualEarnings}
<span class="line-number">86</span>  Days to reach payout: ${earnings.daysToPayoutThreshold}
<span class="line-number">87</span>  Daily data shared: ${earnings.dataShared} GB
<span class="line-number">88</span>`);

Frequently Asked Questions

What is HoneyGain and how does it work?

HoneyGain is a passive income app that pays you for sharing your unused internet bandwidth. The company uses your bandwidth for various legitimate business purposes like web intelligence (price comparison, ad verification), content delivery (improving website load times), market research, and brand protection services. Once installed, the app runs in the background, sharing only your excess bandwidth while you're not using it and crediting your account based on the amount of data shared.

Is HoneyGain safe and legitimate?

Yes, HoneyGain is both safe and legitimate. The company has been operating since 2018 with a solid track record of payments to over 1 million users worldwide. The app only uses your internet connection and doesn't access your personal data, files, or browsing history. HoneyGain is transparent about how they use your bandwidth and has clear privacy policies. I've personally used it for over a year with no security issues and regular payouts.

How much can I realistically earn with HoneyGain in 2025?

Based on current rates and my personal experience, you can earn between $15-30 per month when running HoneyGain on multiple devices (2-4) with a good internet connection. Earnings vary based on your location, internet speed, and usage time. Users in the US, UK, and Western Europe typically earn more than those in other regions. The Content Delivery feature can add an additional $1-3 per day when active, and the referral program can significantly boost your earnings over time.

Will HoneyGain slow down my internet or damage my devices?

HoneyGain is designed to use only your excess bandwidth and has minimal impact on your internet speed. In my testing across multiple devices, I've noticed no significant slowdown during normal usage. The app is also optimized for low resource consumption, using less than 1% CPU and about 50MB of RAM. You can set daily data limits if you have a capped internet plan, and the app automatically pauses when you're actively using bandwidth-intensive applications.

What's the difference between regular sharing and Content Delivery?

HoneyGain offers two earning methods: regular bandwidth sharing and Content Delivery. Regular sharing works everywhere and pays about $0.15 per GB of data in 2025 (up from $0.10 previously). Content Delivery is a premium feature available in select countries that uses your device as a CDN node to deliver content faster to nearby users. Content Delivery typically pays more (around $0.06 per hour when active) but requires your device to be connected to WiFi and have a static IP address.

How do I get paid from HoneyGain?

Once you reach the minimum payout threshold of $20, you can withdraw your earnings via PayPal, Bitcoin, or JumpToken (HoneyGain's native cryptocurrency). Payments are typically processed within 1-3 business days after requesting a withdrawal. PayPal is the most reliable option with no additional fees, though crypto payments can be processed faster in some cases. The $20 threshold typically takes 1-2 months to reach for most users.

How can I maximize my earnings with HoneyGain?

To maximize your HoneyGain earnings: 1) Run the app on multiple devices simultaneously (up to 10 per IP address), 2) Keep devices connected 24/7 if possible, 3) Enable Content Delivery if available in your region, 4) Claim the Lucky Pot daily for bonus credits (worth $0.10-$0.50), 5) Use referral code 'NOSYT123' when signing up for a $5 bonus, and 6) Refer friends to earn 10% of their earnings forever. I've found that running HoneyGain on a Raspberry Pi can be very cost-effective due to its low power consumption.

Is HoneyGain available worldwide?

HoneyGain is available in most countries worldwide, though earnings rates vary by region. The Content Delivery feature is more limited and available primarily in North America, Europe, and parts of Asia. Some countries with strict internet regulations may have restrictions. Always check the current availability for your specific country on the HoneyGain website.

Start Earning with HoneyGain Today

Join thousands of users who are already earning passive income by sharing their unused internet bandwidth.
